speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter HAMLET and Players

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Speak the speech, I pray you, as I pronounced it to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: you, trippingly on the tongue: but if you mouth it,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: as many of your players do, I had as lief the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: town-crier spoke my lines. Nor do not saw the air

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: too much with your hand, thus, but use all gently;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: for in the very torrent, tempest, and, as I may say,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the whirlwind of passion, you must acquire and beget

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: a temperance that may give it smoothness. O, it

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: offends me to the soul to hear a robustious

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: periwig-pated fellow tear a passion to tatters, to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: very rags, to split the ears of the groundlings, who

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: for the most part are capable of nothing but

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: inexplicable dumbshows and noise: I would have such

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: a fellow whipped for o'erdoing Termagant; it

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: out-herods Herod: pray you, avoid it.

speaker: First Player
text_entry: I warrant your honour.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Be not too tame neither, but let your own discretion

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: be your tutor: suit the action to the word, the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: word to the action; with this special o'erstep not

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the modesty of nature: for any thing so overdone is

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: from the purpose of playing, whose end, both at the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: first and now, was and is, to hold, as 'twere, the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: mirror up to nature; to show virtue her own feature,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: scorn her own image, and the very age and body of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the time his form and pressure. Now this overdone,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: or come tardy off, though it make the unskilful

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: laugh, cannot but make the judicious grieve; the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: censure of the which one must in your allowance

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: o'erweigh a whole theatre of others. O, there be

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: players that I have seen play, and heard others

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: praise, and that highly, not to speak it profanely,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: that, neither having the accent of Christians nor

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the gait of Christian, pagan, nor man, have so

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: strutted and bellowed that I have thought some of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: nature's journeymen had made men and not made them

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: well, they imitated humanity so abominably.

speaker: First Player
text_entry: I hope we have reformed that indifferently with us,

speaker: First Player
text_entry: sir.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, reform it altogether. And let those that play

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: your clowns speak no more than is set down for them;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: for there be of them that will themselves laugh, to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: set on some quantity of barren spectators to laugh

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: too; though, in the mean time, some necessary

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: question of the play be then to be considered:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: that's villanous, and shows a most pitiful ambition

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: in the fool that uses it. Go, make you ready.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt Players

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter POLONIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How now, my lord! I will the king hear this piece of work?

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And the queen too, and that presently.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Bid the players make haste.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Will you two help to hasten them?

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: We will, my lord.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What ho! Horatio!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter HORATIO

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Here, sweet lord, at your service.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Horatio, thou art e'en as just a man

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As e'er my conversation coped withal.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: O, my dear lord,--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nay, do not think I flatter;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For what advancement may I hope from thee

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That no revenue hast but thy good spirits,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To feed and clothe thee? Why should the poor be flatter'd?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, let the candied tongue lick absurd pomp,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And crook the pregnant hinges of the knee

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Where thrift may follow fawning. Dost thou hear?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Since my dear soul was mistress of her choice

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And could of men distinguish, her election

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hath seal'd thee for herself; for thou hast been

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As one, in suffering all, that suffers nothing,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A man that fortune's buffets and rewards

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hast ta'en with equal thanks: and blest are those

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whose blood and judgment are so well commingled,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That they are not a pipe for fortune's finger

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To sound what stop she please. Give me that man

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That is not passion's slave, and I will wear him

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: In my heart's core, ay, in my heart of heart,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As I do thee.--Something too much of this.--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: There is a play to-night before the king;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: One scene of it comes near the circumstance

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Which I have told thee of my father's death:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I prithee, when thou seest that act afoot,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Even with the very comment of thy soul

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Observe mine uncle: if his occulted guilt

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do not itself unkennel in one speech,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It is a damned ghost that we have seen,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And my imaginations are as foul

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As Vulcan's stithy. Give him heedful note;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For I mine eyes will rivet to his face,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And after we will both our judgments join

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: In censure of his seeming.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Well, my lord:

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: If he steal aught the whilst this play is playing,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: And 'scape detecting, I will pay the theft.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: They are coming to the play; I must be idle:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Get you a place.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Danish march. A flourish. Enter KING CLAUDIUS,  QUEEN GERTRUDE, POLONIUS, OPHELIA, ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and others

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How fares our cousin Hamlet?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Excellent, i' faith; of the chameleon's dish: I eat

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the air, promise-crammed: you cannot feed capons so.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I have nothing with this answer, Hamlet; these words

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: are not mine.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, nor mine now.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My lord, you played once i' the university, you say?

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: That did I, my lord; and was accounted a good actor.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What did you enact?

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: I did enact Julius Caesar: I was killed i' the

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Capitol; Brutus killed me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It was a brute part of him to kill so capital a calf

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: there. Be the players ready?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Ay, my lord; they stay upon your patience.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Come hither, my dear Hamlet, sit by me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, good mother, here's metal more attractive.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: [To KING CLAUDIUS]  O, ho! do you mark that?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Lady, shall I lie in your lap?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Lying down at OPHELIA's feet

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: No, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I mean, my head upon your lap?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Ay, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do you think I meant country matters?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: I think nothing, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That's a fair thought to lie between maids' legs.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: What is, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nothing.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: You are merry, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Who, I?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Ay, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O God, your only jig-maker. What should a man do

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: but be merry? for, look you, how cheerfully my

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: mother looks, and my father died within these two hours.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Nay, 'tis twice two months, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So long? Nay then, let the devil wear black, for

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I'll have a suit of sables. O heavens! die two

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: months ago, and not forgotten yet? Then there's

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: hope a great man's memory may outlive his life half

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: a year: but, by'r lady, he must build churches,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: then; or else shall he suffer not thinking on, with

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the hobby-horse, whose epitaph is 'For, O, for, O,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the hobby-horse is forgot.'

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hautboys play. The dumb-show enters

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: What means this, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Marry, this is miching mallecho; it means mischief.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Belike this show imports the argument of the play.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Enter Prologue

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: We shall know by this fellow: the players cannot

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: keep counsel; they'll tell all.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Will he tell us what this show meant?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, or any show that you'll show him: be not you

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: ashamed to show, he'll not shame to tell you what it means.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: You are naught, you are naught: I'll mark the play.

speaker: Prologue
text_entry: For us, and for our tragedy,

speaker: Prologue
text_entry: Here stooping to your clemency,

speaker: Prologue
text_entry: We beg your hearing patiently.

speaker: Prologue
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is this a prologue, or the posy of a ring?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: 'Tis brief, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As woman's love.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter two Players, King and Queen

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Full thirty times hath Phoebus' cart gone round

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Neptune's salt wash and Tellus' orbed ground,

speaker: Player King
text_entry: And thirty dozen moons with borrow'd sheen

speaker: Player King
text_entry: About the world have times twelve thirties been,

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Since love our hearts and Hymen did our hands

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Unite commutual in most sacred bands.

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: So many journeys may the sun and moon

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Make us again count o'er ere love be done!

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: But, woe is me, you are so sick of late,

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: So far from cheer and from your former state,

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: That I distrust you. Yet, though I distrust,

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Discomfort you, my lord, it nothing must:

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: For women's fear and love holds quantity;

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: In neither aught, or in extremity.

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Now, what my love is, proof hath made you know;

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: And as my love is sized, my fear is so:

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Where love is great, the littlest doubts are fear;

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Where little fears grow great, great love grows there.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: 'Faith, I must leave thee, love, and shortly too;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: My operant powers their functions leave to do:

speaker: Player King
text_entry: And thou shalt live in this fair world behind,

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Honour'd, beloved; and haply one as kind

speaker: Player King
text_entry: For husband shalt thou--

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: O, confound the rest!

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Such love must needs be treason in my breast:

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: In second husband let me be accurst!

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: None wed the second but who kill'd the first.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: [Aside]  Wormwood, wormwood.

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: The instances that second marriage move

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Are base respects of thrift, but none of love:

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: A second time I kill my husband dead,

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: When second husband kisses me in bed.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: I do believe you think what now you speak;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: But what we do determine oft we break.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Purpose is but the slave to memory,

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Of violent birth, but poor validity;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Which now, like fruit unripe, sticks on the tree;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: But fall, unshaken, when they mellow be.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Most necessary 'tis that we forget

speaker: Player King
text_entry: To pay ourselves what to ourselves is debt:

speaker: Player King
text_entry: What to ourselves in passion we propose,

speaker: Player King
text_entry: The passion ending, doth the purpose lose.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: The violence of either grief or joy

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Their own enactures with themselves destroy:

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Where joy most revels, grief doth most lament;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Grief joys, joy grieves, on slender accident.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: This world is not for aye, nor 'tis not strange

speaker: Player King
text_entry: That even our loves should with our fortunes change;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: For 'tis a question left us yet to prove,

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Whether love lead fortune, or else fortune love.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: The great man down, you mark his favourite flies;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: The poor advanced makes friends of enemies.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: And hitherto doth love on fortune tend;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: For who not needs shall never lack a friend,

speaker: Player King
text_entry: And who in want a hollow friend doth try,

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Directly seasons him his enemy.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: But, orderly to end where I begun,

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Our wills and fates do so contrary run

speaker: Player King
text_entry: That our devices still are overthrown;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Our thoughts are ours, their ends none of our own:

speaker: Player King
text_entry: So think thou wilt no second husband wed;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: But die thy thoughts when thy first lord is dead.

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Nor earth to me give food, nor heaven light!

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Sport and repose lock from me day and night!

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: To desperation turn my trust and hope!

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: An anchor's cheer in prison be my scope!

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Each opposite that blanks the face of joy

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Meet what I would have well and it destroy!

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Both here and hence pursue me lasting strife,

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: If, once a widow, ever I be wife!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If she should break it now!

speaker: Player King
text_entry: 'Tis deeply sworn. Sweet, leave me here awhile;

speaker: Player King
text_entry: My spirits grow dull, and fain I would beguile

speaker: Player King
text_entry: The tedious day with sleep.

speaker: Player King
text_entry: Sleeps

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Sleep rock thy brain,

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: And never come mischance between us twain!

speaker: Player Queen
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Madam, how like you this play?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: The lady protests too much, methinks.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, but she'll keep her word.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Have you heard the argument? Is there no offence in 't?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, no, they do but jest, poison in jest; no offence

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: i' the world.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: What do you call the play?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The Mouse-trap. Marry, how? Tropically. This play

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: is the image of a murder done in Vienna: Gonzago is

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the duke's name; his wife, Baptista: you shall see

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: anon; 'tis a knavish piece of work: but what o'

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: that? your majesty and we that have free souls, it

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: touches us not: let the galled jade wince, our

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: withers are unwrung.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter LUCIANUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This is one Lucianus, nephew to the king.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: You are as good as a chorus, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I could interpret between you and your love, if I

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: could see the puppets dallying.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: You are keen, my lord, you are keen.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It would cost you a groaning to take off my edge.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Still better, and worse.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So you must take your husbands. Begin, murderer;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: pox, leave thy damnable faces, and begin. Come:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: 'the croaking raven doth bellow for revenge.'

speaker: LUCIANUS
text_entry: Thoughts black, hands apt, drugs fit, and time agreeing;

speaker: LUCIANUS
text_entry: Confederate season, else no creature seeing;

speaker: LUCIANUS
text_entry: Thou mixture rank, of midnight weeds collected,

speaker: LUCIANUS
text_entry: With Hecate's ban thrice blasted, thrice infected,

speaker: LUCIANUS
text_entry: Thy natural magic and dire property,

speaker: LUCIANUS
text_entry: On wholesome life usurp immediately.

speaker: LUCIANUS
text_entry: Pours the poison into the sleeper's ears

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He poisons him i' the garden for's estate. His

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: name's Gonzago: the story is extant, and writ in

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: choice Italian: you shall see anon how the murderer

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: gets the love of Gonzago's wife.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: The king rises.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What, frighted with false fire!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: How fares my lord?

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Give o'er the play.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Give me some light: away!

speaker: All
text_entry: Lights, lights, lights!

speaker: All
text_entry: Exeunt all but HAMLET and HORATIO

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, let the stricken deer go weep,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The hart ungalled play;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For some must watch, while some must sleep:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So runs the world away.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would not this, sir, and a forest of feathers-- if

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the rest of my fortunes turn Turk with me--with two

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Provincial roses on my razed shoes, get me a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: fellowship in a cry of players, sir?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Half a share.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A whole one, I.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For thou dost know, O Damon dear,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This realm dismantled was

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of Jove himself; and now reigns here

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A very, very--pajock.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: You might have rhymed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O good Horatio, I'll take the ghost's word for a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: thousand pound. Didst perceive?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Very well, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Upon the talk of the poisoning?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: I did very well note him.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ah, ha! Come, some music! come, the recorders!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For if the king like not the comedy,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why then, belike, he likes it not, perdy.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Come, some music!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Re-enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Good my lord, vouchsafe me a word with you.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sir, a whole history.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: The king, sir,--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, sir, what of him?

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Is in his retirement marvellous distempered.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With drink, sir?

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: No, my lord, rather with choler.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Your wisdom should show itself more richer to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: signify this to his doctor; for, for me to put him

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: to his purgation would perhaps plunge him into far

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: more choler.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Good my lord, put your discourse into some frame and

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: start not so wildly from my affair.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I am tame, sir: pronounce.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: The queen, your mother, in most great affliction of

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: spirit, hath sent me to you.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You are welcome.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Nay, good my lord, this courtesy is not of the right

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: breed. If it shall please you to make me a

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: wholesome answer, I will do your mother's

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: commandment: if not, your pardon and my return

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: shall be the end of my business.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sir, I cannot.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: What, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Make you a wholesome answer; my wit's diseased: but,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: sir, such answer as I can make, you shall command;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: or, rather, as you say, my mother: therefore no

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: more, but to the matter: my mother, you say,--

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Then thus she says; your behavior hath struck her

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: into amazement and admiration.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O wonderful son, that can so astonish a mother! But

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: is there no sequel at the heels of this mother's

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: admiration? Impart.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: She desires to speak with you in her closet, ere you

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: go to bed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: We shall obey, were she ten times our mother. Have

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: you any further trade with us?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: My lord, you once did love me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So I do still, by these pickers and stealers.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Good my lord, what is your cause of distemper? you

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: do, surely, bar the door upon your own liberty, if

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: you deny your griefs to your friend.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sir, I lack advancement.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: How can that be, when you have the voice of the king

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: himself for your succession in Denmark?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, but sir, 'While the grass grows,'--the proverb

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: is something musty.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Re-enter Players with recorders

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, the recorders! let me see one. To withdraw with

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: you:--why do you go about to recover the wind of me,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: as if you would drive me into a toil?

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: O, my lord, if my duty be too bold, my love is too

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: unmannerly.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I do not well understand that. Will you play upon

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: this pipe?

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: My lord, I cannot.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I pray you.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Believe me, I cannot.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I do beseech you.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: I know no touch of it, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: 'Tis as easy as lying: govern these ventages with

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: your lingers and thumb, give it breath with your

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: mouth, and it will discourse most eloquent music.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Look you, these are the stops.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: But these cannot I command to any utterance of

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: harmony; I have not the skill.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, look you now, how unworthy a thing you make of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: me! You would play upon me; you would seem to know

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: my stops; you would pluck out the heart of my

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: mystery; you would sound me from my lowest note to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the top of my compass: and there is much music,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: excellent voice, in this little organ; yet cannot

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: you make it speak. 'Sblood, do you think I am

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: easier to be played on than a pipe? Call me what

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: instrument you will, though you can fret me, yet you

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: cannot play upon me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: God bless you, sir!

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: My lord, the queen would speak with you, and

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: presently.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do you see yonder cloud that's almost in shape of a camel?

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: By the mass, and 'tis like a camel, indeed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Methinks it is like a weasel.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: It is backed like a weasel.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or like a whale?

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Very like a whale.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Then I will come to my mother by and by. They fool

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: me to the top of my bent. I will come by and by.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: I will say so.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: By and by is easily said.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Leave me, friends.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt all but HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Tis now the very witching time of night,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Contagion to this world: now could I drink hot blood,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And do such bitter business as the day

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would quake to look on. Soft! now to my mother.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O heart, lose not thy nature; let not ever

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The soul of Nero enter this firm bosom:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Let me be cruel, not unnatural:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I will speak daggers to her, but use none;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My tongue and soul in this be hypocrites;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How in my words soever she be shent,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To give them seals never, my soul, consent!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit
